alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 457 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ruidoso, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs, Capitan, Bonito Lake, Alto, Smokey Bear Historical Park, Hollywood and Angus. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 83 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
